facts.1: Dr. Seuss Day, also known as Read Across America Day, is celebrated on March 2nd to honor the birthday of the beloved children's author Dr. Seuss.
facts.2: The day encourages children and adults to read books and participate in reading activities to promote literacy.
facts.3: Dr. Seuss, whose real name was Theodor Seuss Geisel, wrote and illustrated over 60 books, including classics like 'The Cat in the Hat' and 'Green Eggs and Ham.'

facts.1: National Banana Cream Pie Day celebrates the delicious dessert made with a creamy banana filling, a flaky crust, and topped with whipped cream.
facts.2: Banana cream pie is a classic American dessert that has been enjoyed for generations.
facts.3: The day encourages people to bake and enjoy banana cream pie with family and friends.

facts.1: Old Stuff Day is observed on March 2nd to encourage people to appreciate and find new uses for old items.
facts.2: The day promotes recycling, repurposing, and upcycling to reduce waste and give new life to old belongings.
facts.3: Old Stuff Day is a great opportunity to declutter, donate unused items, and explore creative ways to reuse and repurpose old stuff.
